page.title: 09LOCAL HISTORY IN THE AREA
page.content:
{PRE-RECORDED HISTORY ____________________ Behind the Duchy Hospital (Page 5) lies the remains of a "settlement" common to the camps in the Bronze/Iron Age. The settlement consists of a circle of earth, topped by trees. The settelment was wisely placed on the leeward side of a hill. Today it is surrounded by modern fertilized grassland.
{RELIGIOUS HISTORY} _________________ Scattered among the older houses along the main Truro-Redruth road are some disused chapels. John Wesley made several visits to this area and Methodist chapels spang up in his wake. Nowadays local craftsman use some as stores or workshops.
